intro: Bunium sewerzowii, commonly known as the Siberian fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Bunium sewerzowii is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional medicine and have a distinct licorice-like scent.
